messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

- Full path:
  /api/orders/{id}/pay

- all HTTP methods acceptable:
  false

- HEAD:
  false

- POST:
  false

- OPTIONS:
  false

- TRACE:
  false

- GET:
  false

- PUT:
  true

- DELETE:
  false

- PATCH:
  false

Explanation:
- server.js mounts the order routes at the prefix /api/orders via app.use('/api/orders', orderRoutes).
- routes/orderRoutes.js registers router.route('/:id/pay').put(protect, updateOrderToPaid), so the endpoint path is /api/orders/:id/pay â€” with the path parameter expressed as {id} this becomes /api/orders/{id}/pay.
- The route is explicitly registered only for the PUT method (with the protect middleware). No other methods are registered for that exact path in the provided routing file.
- The controller comment in controllers/orderController.js also documents the route as PUT /api/orders/:id/pay.
- Per your instruction to base acceptability on the code (not on Express implicit behavior), only the explicitly defined PUT method is considered acceptable.
